metadata.feature_description: Generate and manage workflow action links for files and pages to facilitate workflow transitions.

steps.action: Navigate to API endpoint /API/EvoqContentLibrary/WorkflowsLinks/Index/?id=21&type=1 with authenticated session
steps.expected: API should redirect to the target page (Home page with ID 21) in edit mode
steps.actual: Successfully redirected to Home page (http://localhost:8081/en-us/) in edit mode with pane names visible (TopPane, ContentPane, etc.)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Generate workflow link for file - DAM module dependency

steps.action: Navigate to API endpoint /API/EvoqContentLibrary/WorkflowsLinks/Index/?id=1&type=2 with authenticated session
steps.expected: API should return appropriate response - either redirect to file properties or error message if DAM module not found
steps.actual: API returned 'Sorry, DAM module not found' error message, indicating the file workflow link requires a Digital Asset Management module to be present

steps.expected: API should return file not found error
steps.actual: API returned 'Sorry, file Not found' error message, confirming proper error handling for invalid file IDs

steps.action: Log out and attempt to access workflow link API /API/EvoqContentLibrary/WorkflowsLinks/Index/?id=21&type=1 without authentication
steps.expected: API should redirect unauthenticated users to login page
steps.actual: Successfully redirected to login page with return URL pointing back to the API endpoint

observations: The Workflow Link Actions feature is an internal API-based functionality used in workflow notifications rather than a direct UI feature.
The API endpoint is /API/EvoqContentLibrary/WorkflowsLinks/Index/?id={id}&type={type} where type=1 is for pages (Tab) and type=2 is for files.
For page workflow links (type=Tab), the API sets the user to edit mode and redirects to the page.
For file workflow links (type=File), a Digital Asset Management (DAM) module must be present on the site to redirect to file properties.

The link expiration scenario could not be tested as the feature does not appear to have a time-based expiration mechanism in the code - links remain valid as long as the content exists and the user has permission.
The feature properly implements authentication checks, redirecting unauthenticated users to the login page with a return URL for post-login redirect.
